title: Kylian Mbappe suffers knee injury , Real Madrid issue statement
body_text:
By Web Desk
December 31, 2025
Real Madrid forward Kylian Mbappe has been ruled out for three weeks after MRI scans confirmed the knee ligament injury.
According to the French publication L'Équipe, the former Paris Saint-Germain striker was playing through the pain, and now, after confirmation of his injury, the Los Blancos have announced that Mbappe will miss the action for the next few weeks.
He will miss the Spanish Super Cup and the final two games of the UEFA Champions League matches of the league phase.
L'Equipe further said that Mbappe was unsure about the injury and wanted to play the previous games at any cost. He was not 100% after returning to training this week, and the club has now released an official statement.
"After the tests carried out today on our player Kylian Mbappé by the Real Madrid Medical Services, he has been diagnosed with a sprain in his left knee. Pending evolution," the statement read.
Mbappe took the December break to witness the AFCON matches last week and was seen enjoying matches in the stadium.
The former PSG striker was in fine form before the season stalled, scoring 18 goals in the league and another 9 in 5 Champions League matches.
He recently celebrated his 27th birthday in style by equalling Cristiano Ronaldo’s club record of 59 goals in a calendar year for Real Madrid with a late penalty in a 2-0 LaLiga win over Sevilla here at Estadio Bernabeu on December 20.
Kylian Mbappe expressed admiration for Cristiano Ronaldo, calling him his idol and praising his achievements, while celebrating that he has matched one of Ronaldo’s records in his first year.
"Today, and because of the record, it's incredible, in my first year to be able to do what Cristiano did," Mbappe said.
"My idol, the best player in the history of Real Madrid and a reference in world football. It's an honour for me."
